Attraction.Name: Petronas Twin Towers
Attraction.Description: The Petronas Twin Towers are twin skyscrapers in Kuala Lumpur. At 451.9 meters, they were the tallest buildings in the world from 1998 to 2004.

Attraction.Name: Batu Caves
Attraction.Description: Batu Caves is a limestone hill that has a series of caves and cave temples. It is one of the most popular Hindu shrines outside India.

Attraction.Name: Langkawi Sky Bridge
Attraction.Description: The Langkawi Sky Bridge is a 125-meter curved pedestrian cable-stayed bridge. It offers an incredible view of the Langkawi islands.

Attraction.Name: Kinabalu Park
Attraction.Description: Kinabalu Park is Malaysia's first UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is home to Mount Kinabalu, the highest mountain in Malaysia.

Attraction.Name: A Famosa
Attraction.Description: A Famosa is a historical Portuguese fortress located in Melaka. It is among the oldest surviving European architectural remains in Southeast Asia.

Attraction.Name: Penang Hill
Attraction.Description: Penang Hill is a hill resort comprising a group of peaks in Penang. It features the world's steepest tunnel track funicular railway.

Attraction.Name: Sarawak Cultural Village
Attraction.Description: Sarawak Cultural Village is a living museum that showcases the diverse cultural heritage of Sarawak's various ethnic groups.

Attraction.Name: National Museum
Attraction.Description: The National Museum is Malaysia's main museum. It displays the nation's historical, cultural and natural heritage through exhibitions and artifacts.

Attraction.Name: Sunway Lagoon
Attraction.Description: Sunway Lagoon is a theme park with water rides, adventure rides, wildlife park, extreme park and more, providing fun for all ages.

Attraction.Name: Taman Negara
Attraction.Description: Taman Negara is one of the oldest rainforests in the world, estimated to be over 130 million years old. It offers jungle trekking, wildlife watching, and canopy walks.
